title: Kennedy Center Honors Ratings Plummet After Trump Takeover
description: Ratings for the Kennedy Center Honors took a sharp decline this year. The poor turnout comes shortly after Donald Trump added his name to the histor
body:
Ratings for the Kennedy Center Honors took a sharp decline this year. The poor turnout comes shortly after Donald Trump added his name to the historic forum.

	This yearâ€™s Kennedy Center Honors, hosted by Trump, averaged 3.01 million viewers, according to a report from Nielsen Live + Same Day Panel + Big Data. That represents a 25% dip from last yearâ€™s numbers. The 2024 show hit a record low of 4.1 million viewers after reaching 4.5 million viewers the year before.
	

	The Kennedy Center did not immediately respond to Varietyâ€™s request for comment.


	Trump is the first sitting president to host the Kennedy Center Honors, which celebrate â€œindividuals whose unique contributions have shaped our world,â€ according to the organizationâ€™s website. This yearâ€™s honorees were George Strait, Sylvester Stallone, KISS, Michael Crawford and Gloria Gaynor.

	On Dec. 6, the day before the event, Trump told reporters at the White House, â€œItâ€™s going to be something that I believe, and Iâ€™m going to make a prediction: This will be the highest-rated show that theyâ€™ve ever done and theyâ€™ve gotten some pretty good ratings, but thereâ€™s nothing like whatâ€™s going to happen tomorrow night.â€

	Trump has set his sights on remaking the Kennedy Center in his image during his second term, even going so far as to rename the venue â€œThe Donald J. Trump and The John F. Kennedy Memorial Center for the Performing Artsâ€ in mid December. The name change has been met with significant blowback, and several scheduled acts have canceled their upcoming performances as a result.

schema.headline: Kennedy Center Honors Ratings Plummet After Trump Takeover

title: Canal+ and Warner Bros. Discovery Strike New International Agreement, Including HBO Max Expansion
description: Canal+ and Warner Bros. Discovery have signed a new multi-year, multi-territory agreement to strengthen their partnership internationally, including
body:
Canal+ and Warner Bros. Discovery have signed a new multi-year, multi-territory agreement to strengthen their partnership internationally, including the expansion of HBO Max to two more countries.

	Through the pact, which a press release calls a â€œmajor milestoneâ€ in the companiesâ€™ collaboration, distribution of HBO Max via Canal+ will be renewed in Poland, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Hungary, and Romania, and will expand to Belgium and Austria. Distribution of Cartoon Network, Cartoonito and CNN International in Romania, Hungary, the Czech Republic and Slovakia will also be renewed, as will Warner TV in the Czech Republic.
	

	Across MultiChoice Group territories in Africa, distribution of 12 WBD thematic channels will be renewed, including CNN International and Cartoon Network, Cartoon Network Porto, Cartoonito, Cartoonito Porto, Discovery Channel, Discovery Family, Real Time, ID, TLC, HGTV, Travel, TNT Africa and Food Network.


	The agreement between WBD and the French media group builds upon previous deals made in 2024, including the renewal of the exclusive pay-TV window for Warner Bros. Pictures films six months after their theatrical release in France and the integration of HBO Max within select Canal+ group offers. 

	It also comes during Netflixâ€™s pending purchase of WBD, which could further position Canal+ as a power player on the global stage as the company already has distribution deals in place with Netflix. On Dec. 16, Netflix boss Ted Sarandos made a surprise appearance at Canal+ Groupâ€™s Paris showcase and reassured the audience of his plans in purchasing WBD.
	

	â€œOur intentions when we buy Warner Bros. will be to continue to release Warner Bros. studio movies in theaters with the traditional windows,â€ Sarandos said during a conversation with Canal+ chair and CEO Maxime Saada. â€œThen those movies would flow through the Canal+ output deal. Thatâ€™s very exciting for us.â€

schema.headline: Canal+ and Warner Bros. Discovery Strike New International Agreement, Including HBO Max Expansion

title: CNNâ€™s Jake Tapper Calls Out Trump for â€˜Attacking the Kennedy Familyâ€™ Hours After Death of JFKâ€™s Granddaughter Tatiana Schlossberg: â€˜Social Media Garbageâ€™
description: Donald Trump stirred up controversy after taking to Truth Social to share takedowns of the Kennedy family, mere hours after the tragic death of JFKâ€™
body:
Donald Trump stirred up controversy after taking to Truth Social to share takedowns of the Kennedy family, mere hours after the tragic death of JFKâ€™s granddaughter Tatiana Schlossberg at 35 years old. Schlossberg, a former climate and energy reporter at the New York Times, was diagnosed with acute myeloid leukemia after her daughter was born in 2024.Â 

	One message that Trump re-posted read: â€œThe Trumps have always been supporters of the arts. The Kennedys are supporters of the Kennedys.â€ 
	

	Another noted: â€œThey donâ€™t raise money for it. They never show up. And the only Kennedy who has been there recently is a member of Trumpâ€™s cabinet.â€

	Trumpâ€™s post were not in reference to Schlossbergâ€™s death but to the drama surrounding his continued takeover of the Kennedy Center. He renamed the venueÂ â€œThe Donald J. Trump and The John F. Kennedy Memorial Center for the Performing Artsâ€ in mid December to much controversy and blowback from various members of the Kennedy family. His takeover has resulted in several scheduled acts canceling their upcoming performances.

	Even if Trump wasnâ€™t addressing Schlossberg, many on social media found his timing tasteless and cruel as the Kennedy family mourns the loss of one of their own. CNNâ€™s Jake Tapper called out Trumpâ€™s behavior on X, sharing screenshots of the presidentâ€™s Kennedy bashing and writing; â€œIn the early afternoon, ET, the Kennedy family announced that JFKâ€™s granddaughter Tatiana Schlossberg had died from cancer. A few hours later, President Trump re-posted some social media garbage attacking the Kennedy family.â€
	

	Itâ€™s not the first time this month Trump has made headlines for attacking a grieving family. The president earned widespread backlash for attacking Rob Reiner after the directorâ€™s death in early December. Trump alleged that Reinerâ€™s death was â€œdue to the anger he caused othersâ€Â from being outspokenly anti-Trump. Reinerâ€™s son, Nick, has been arrested in connection to his parentsâ€™ deaths. Trump later called the filmmaker a â€œderanged personâ€ who â€œwas very bad for our country.â€

	â€œThe Rob Reiner thing is not funny,â€ Joe Rogan recently said in opposition to Trumpâ€™s behavior. â€œWhen you see it with no empathy, thatâ€™s when itâ€™s hard to like. Listen, thereâ€™s no justification for what he did that makes any sense in a compassionate society. Itâ€™s no different than people that were celebrating when Charlie Kirk got shot. Itâ€™s the same kind of thingâ€¦ Â Itâ€™s so disappointing. Itâ€™s like whyâ€¦ if you say that privately thatâ€™s one thing, which is also crazy, but itâ€™s so disappointing.â€

In the early afternoon, ET, the Kennedy family announced that JFKâ€™s granddaughter Tatiana Schlossberg had died from cancer. A few hours later, President Trump re-posted some social media garbage attacking the Kennedy family. pic.twitter.com/1gRaX8V71yâ€” Jake Tapper ğŸ¦… (@jaketapper) December 31, 2025

schema.headline: CNNâ€™s Jake Tapper Calls Out Trump for â€˜Attacking the Kennedy Familyâ€™ Hours After Death of JFKâ€™s Granddaughter Tatiana Schlossberg: â€˜Social Media Garbageâ€™

title: Warner Bros. Discovery Board Poised to Reject Paramountâ€™s Latest Offer, Stay the Course With Netflix
description: The board of Warner Bros. Discovery is poised to reject the amended takeover offer fielded by Paramount Skydance last week as David Ellison keeps up
body:
The board of Warner Bros. Discovery is poised to reject the amended takeover offer fielded by Paramount Skydance last week as David Ellison keeps up his pursuit of the assets he sees as crucial to building a 21st century Hollywood heavyweight.

	Bloomberg News reported Tuesday that the WBD board was expected to reject the amended offer that was made with fanfare by Paramount Skydance on Dec. 22. WBD has already struck an agreement to merge with Netflix in a deal valued at more than $80 billion. 
	

	But Paramount Skydance hasnâ€™t given up and is making a tender offer to WBD shareholders. As this tug-of-war has played out in press releases and conference calls and Securities and Exchange Commission filings, WBD shares have soared more than 170% this year, albeit shares were at a low ebb, having traded under $10 for most of 2024. Bloomberg reported the WBD board will meet next week to formally vote on a response to Paramountâ€™s latest offer. A WBD representative declined to comment on matter.


	The WBD boardâ€™s expected decision is not a surprise given there have been no signs of a significant about-face in the panelâ€™s thinking about which company is the best fit for Warner Bros. and HBO Max. There is also much industry intrigue about how far Paramount is willing to go, if at all, in raising the financial value of its bid higher than the existing $30 a share. 

	Paramountâ€™s amended offer from last week largely dealt with the financing of the all-cash transaction. Software billionaire Larry Ellison, who is the father of David Ellison, took steps to address the WBDâ€™s stated concerns about the sources of Paramountâ€™s financing. Larry Ellison enlarged his personal stake in the transaction by making an â€œirrevocable personal guarantee of $40.4 billionâ€ toward Paramountâ€™s $108 billion all-cash offer for all of WBD. That includes CNN, TNT and a handful of other established linear cable channels that are now on track to be spunoff into a separate company next year.
	

	Paramountâ€™s amended offer of Dec. 22 also upped the breakup fee to match Netflixâ€™s $5.8 billion figure, payable to WBD in the event that its deal does not clear regulatory review. Netflixâ€™s deal is valued at just under $83 billion but does not include the linear cable channels. Netflixâ€™s deal is a mix of cash and stock.

	If the expected WBD board rejection spurs Paramount to raise its offer, then the ball moves to Netflixâ€™s court. Itâ€™s unclear what, if any, willingness Netflix has to raise its hand.

schema.headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Board Poised to Reject Paramountâ€™s Latest Offer, Stay the Course With Netflix

title: Meyer Gottlieb, Samuel Goldwyn Films Co-Founder and Producer of â€˜Master and Commander,â€™ Dies at 86
description: Meyer Gottlieb, who headed Samuel Goldwyn Films and produced films including â€œMaster and Commander: The Far Side of the World,â€ died Monday in Los A
body:
Meyer Gottlieb, who headed Samuel Goldwyn Films and produced films including â€œMaster and Commander: The Far Side of the World,â€ died Monday in Los Angeles. He was 86. 

	Tom Rothman, Chairman and CEO of Sony Pictures Motion Picture Group, said in a statement, â€œMeyer was a gentleman of the old school. I was fortunate to work for him when he ran the Samuel Goldwyn Company, in the heyday of independent film. I learned an enormous amount from him â€” most importantly, that it is possible to make a life in Hollywood without sacrificing integrity and honesty, both of which he embodied entirely, along with smarts, wisdom, and kindness. I send my sincere condolences to his loving family during this difficult time.â€
	

	Born in Poland just before the Germans invaded, Gottlieb was a Holocaust survivor who lived in Ukraine labor camps during the war and then in a displaced personâ€™s camp in Germany. After a great aunt brought him to Los Angeles, he learned English at school and eventually graduated from UCLA. 


	He became president and COO of the Samuel Goldwyn Co. in 1988 after helped Samuel Goldwyn Jr. revive the company in 1978 with classic films from Goldwynâ€™s fatherâ€™s library. 

	Among the other films he produced for Goldwyn were â€œThe Secret Life of Walter Mittyâ€ remake, starring Ben Stiller. As a top Goldwyn executive, he shepherded releases including the received Michael Apted film â€œAmazing Grace,â€ â€œMystic Pizza,â€ â€œEat, Drink, Man, Woman,â€ â€œSuper Size Meâ€ and â€œThe Squid and the Whale.â€

	He is survived by his wife Pattikay, two daughters and two grandchildren.

schema.headline: Meyer Gottlieb, Samuel Goldwyn Films Co-Founder and Producer of â€˜Master and Commander,â€™ Dies at 86

title: Spike Lee Shares Tribute to Isiah Whitlock Jr.: â€˜My Dear Beloved Brotherâ€™
description:
Spike Lee has paid tribute to his longtime collaborator Isiah Whitlock Jr., who died on Tuesday in New York at age 71. 

	Lee shared a photo of hims
body:
Spike Lee has paid tribute to his longtime collaborator Isiah Whitlock Jr., who died on Tuesday in New York at age 71. 

	Lee shared a photo of himself with Whitlock on Instagram on Tuesday, writing, â€œToday I Learned Of The Passing Of My Dear Beloved Brother ISIAH WHITLOCK. GOD BLESS.â€

	Whitlock played small roles in several of Leeâ€™s films, including â€œRed Hook Summer,â€ â€œChi-Raq,â€ â€œShe Hate Meâ€ and â€œ25th Hour.â€ His two major roles in Leeâ€™s filmography came with â€œDa Five Bloods,â€ in which he plays Vietnam veteran Melvin alongside Delroy Lindo, Jonathan Majors, Clarke Peters and Norm Lewis, and â€œBlackKkKlansman,â€ in which he starred as police officer Mr. Turrentine alongside Alec Baldwin, John David Washington and Robert John Burke.
	

	Brian Liebman, Whitlockâ€™s manager, shared the news of his death in an Instagram post. He wrote, â€œIt is with tremendous sadness that I share the passing of my dear friend and client Isiah Whitlock Jr. If you knew him â€” you loved him. A brilliant actor and even better person. May his memory forever be a blessing. Our hearts are so broken. He will be very, very missed.â€

	Whitlock was best known for playing the crooked state senator Clay Davis on â€œThe Wire.â€ He also appeared in a recurring role on Seasons 2 through 4 of â€œVeepâ€ as U.S. Secretary of Defense George Maddox, who runs against Julia Louis-Dreyfusâ€™ character Selina Meyer in the 2016 primaries.

	The Indiana-born character actor also had small roles in â€œGoodfellas,â€ â€œChappelleâ€™s Show,â€ â€œPieces of April,â€ â€œEnchanted,â€ â€œCars 3â€ and â€œLightyear.â€ His voice can be heard in Pixarâ€™s â€œHoppers,â€ which is set to debut in 2026.

schema.headline: Spike Lee Shares Tribute to Isiah Whitlock Jr.: â€˜My Dear Beloved Brotherâ€™

title: Yashâ€™s â€˜Toxicâ€™ Unveils First Look of Nayanthara as Ganga (EXCLUSIVE)
description: The team behind Yashâ€˜s highly anticipated â€œToxic â€“ A Fairytale for Grown-Upsâ€ has revealed the first look at Nayanthara as Ganga, presenting the act
body:
The team behind Yashâ€˜s highly anticipated â€œToxic â€“ A Fairytale for Grown-Upsâ€ has revealed the first look at Nayanthara as Ganga, presenting the actress in a role that combines visual intensity with a commanding presence.

	The poster positions Nayanthara in front of an ornate casino entrance, weapon in hand, projecting controlled power within a high-stakes luxury environment. The image marks a departure for the actor, suggesting a character defined by calculated authority rather than conventional heroism.
	

	Nayanthara has established herself as one of Indiaâ€™s most acclaimed actor over a two-decade career spanning more than 75 films across Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada-language cinema. Her filmography includes women-centric successes like â€œAramm,â€ â€œKolamaavu Kokilaâ€ and â€œNetrikann,â€ alongside Shah Rukh Khanâ€™s blockbuster â€œJawan.â€


	Yash, the Kannada-language film industry actor who rose to pan-Indian stardom with the â€œK.G.Fâ€ franchise, has become one of the most sought-after stars in Indian cinema. Known for his portrayal of Rocky Bhai in â€œK.G.F: Chapter 1â€ (2018) and â€œK.G.F: Chapter 2â€ (2022) Yashâ€™s transformation into a larger-than-life action hero propelled the films to unprecedented box-office success, breaking language barriers. The second instalment in the franchise is the fifth highest Indian grosser of all time. While the â€œK.G.Fâ€ series cemented his star power, Yashâ€™s early career in Kannada-language films showcased his versatility, with notable performances in projects such as â€œMr. and Mrs. Ramachariâ€ (2014) and â€œGooglyâ€ (2013).
	

	â€œToxicâ€ is helmed by festival circuit darlingÂ Geetu MohandasÂ (â€œMoothonâ€).Â The ambitious project represents a watershed moment for Kannada cinema, which has been steadily gaining international traction following the â€œK.G.Fâ€ phenomenon. Written by Yash and Mohandas, â€œToxicâ€ is breaking new ground as the first major Indian film conceptualized,Â written and shot simultaneously in both the Kannada and English languagesÂ â€“ with dubbed versions planned for Hindi, Telugu, Tamil, Malayalam and additional languages.

	â€œWe all know Nayan as a celebrated star with a commanding screen presence, and a remarkable career spanning two decades but in â€˜Toxic,â€™ audiences will witness a talent that had been quietly waiting to explode,â€ said director Geetu Mohandas. â€œI wanted to portray Nayan in a way that sheâ€™s never been showcased before. But as the shoot progressed I began to see how closely her own personality echoed the soul of the character. It wasnâ€™t imitation, it was alignment. The depth, the honesty, the restraint, and the emotional clarity she brought were not performances layered on top of the character, they were qualities she already possessed. I found my Ganga, so brilliantly performed by her, and even more unexpectedly, I found a dear friend.â€

	The reveal follows previous character unveilings for the production, including Kiara Advani as Nadia and Huma Qureshi as Elizabeth, each presenting distinct visual aesthetics within the filmâ€™s narrative world.

	The production has assembled a notable technical crew including Indian National Film Award-winning cinematographer Rajeev Ravi, composer Ravi Basrur, editor Ujwal Kulkarni and production designer T.P. Abid. Action sequences have beenÂ choreographed by Hollywoodâ€™s J.J. Perry, known for his work on â€œJohn Wick,â€ alongside Indian National Film Award-winning duo Anbariv and Kecha Khamphakdee.

	Produced by Venkat K. Narayana and Yash through KVN Productions and Monster Mind Creations, â€œToxic â€“ A Fairytale for Grown-Upsâ€ isÂ scheduled for theatrical release March 19, 2026, capitalizing on the extended holiday weekend that encompasses Eid, Ugadi and Gudi Padwa celebrations.

schema.headline: Yashâ€™s â€˜Toxicâ€™ Unveils First Look of Nayanthara as Ganga (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Bari Weiss Invites George Clooney to Visit Broadcast Center After He Tells Variety She Is â€˜Dismantlingâ€™ CBS News
description: After George Clooney said he felt that newly-named editor-in-chief Bari Weiss was â€œdismantling CBS News as we speak,â€ Weiss has responded by invitin
body:
After George Clooney said he felt that newly-named editor-in-chief Bari Weiss was â€œdismantling CBS News as we speak,â€ Weiss has responded by inviting him to visit the CBS newsroom. 

	â€œBonjour, Mr. Clooney! Big fan of your work. It sounds like youâ€™d like to learn more about ours. This is an open invitation to visit The CBS Broadcast Center, where Iâ€™m spending the holidays working to relaunch the Evening News with my colleagues. Tune in January 5,â€ Weiss said in a statement shared by Paramount Skydance. The â€œbonjourâ€ was presumably a reference to Clooney, his wife Amal and their twins becoming French citizens this week.
	

	In a wide-ranging interview with Brent Lang about his career and his latest film â€œJay Kelly,â€ Clooney also touched on the upheaval at CBS News, politics and his activism.


	â€œAm I worried about film studios? Sure. Itâ€™s my business, but my primary loyalty is to my country. Iâ€™m much more worried about how we inform ourselves and how weâ€™re going to discern reality without a functioning press,â€ he said. 

	Clooney also addressed President Trumpâ€™s lawsuits against ABC News and CBS News in Varietyâ€˜s interview. â€œIf CBS and ABC had challenged those lawsuits and said, â€˜Go fuck yourself,â€™ we wouldnâ€™t be where we are in the country,â€ Clooney says. â€œThatâ€™s simply the truth.â€

	Weiss, who took over CBS News in October, recently came under fire for abruptly pulling a â€œ60 Minutesâ€ report on El Salvadorâ€™s CECOT prison.

	The response from Weiss was first reported by the New York Post.

schema.headline: Bari Weiss Invites George Clooney to Visit Broadcast Center After He Tells Variety She Is â€˜Dismantlingâ€™ CBS News

title: Women Directors Make Up 8% of This Yearâ€™s 100 Top-Grossing Filmmakers in a Steep Drop From 2024, Study Shows
description: A new study describes 2025 as a â€œGreat Recessionâ€ for women directors, with just nine women directors attached to the 100 top-grossing films at the
body:
A new study describes 2025 as a â€œGreat Recessionâ€ for women directors, with just nine women directors attached to the 100 top-grossing films at the U.S. box office.

	According to the latest report from the USC Annenberg Inclusion Initiative, of the 111 directors who helmed those films, nine of them were women: Nisha Ganatra (â€œFreakier Fridayâ€), Emma Tammi (â€œFive Nights at Freddyâ€™s 2â€), Domee Shi (â€œElioâ€), Madeline Sharafian (â€œElioâ€), Celine Song (â€œMaterialistsâ€), Jennifer Kaytin Robinson (â€œI Know What You Did Last Summerâ€), Maggie Kang (â€œKPop Demon Huntersâ€), Hikari (â€œRental Familyâ€) and previous best director Oscar winner ChloÃ© Zhao (â€œHamnetâ€).
	

	The 2025 figure (8.1 %, which calculates a ratio of 11.3 men to every one woman) represents a steep drop from 2024, when the percentage of women directors on the 100 top-grossing films was 13.4% (15 directors), when the U.S. was in the throes of the financial Great Recession.


	â€œThe 2025 data reveals that progress for women directors has been fleeting,â€ stated Dr. Stacy L. Smith, the studyâ€™s author and founder of the Annenberg Inclusion Initiative. â€œWhile it is tempting to think that these changes are a result of who is in the Oval Office, in reality, these results are driven by executive decision-making that took place long before any DEI prohibitions took effect. Many of these films were greenlit and in pre-production before the 2024 election.â€

	The study, titled â€œInclusion in the Directorâ€™s Chairâ€ and now in its seventh iteration, examines the gender and race/ethnicity of directors across 2025â€™s 100 top-grossing films, as well as analyzes trends including hiring patterns by distributor and the average and median Metacritic scores by director gender and race/ethnicity. The report surveys a total of 1,900 films released between 2007 and 2025.
	

	Of the 111 directors in 2024, only three of the women (Song, Zhao and Tammi) have previously helmed a film in the sample. Just 24 women have directed more than one top-grossing film between 2007 and 2025. Top-performing women directors were Anne Fletcher (four films), Lana Wachowski (four films) and Greta Gerwig (three films), while 21 women helmed two movies.

	Less than a quarter (24.3%) of directors in 2025 were from underrepresented racial/ethnic groups in 2025. This figure is unchanged from 2024 (24.1%) and significantly higher than the 12.5% reported in 2007.

	At the intersection of race and gender, only 5.4% of directors this year were women of color, but 2025 marks the first year where the number of women of color (six) outnumbered the number of white women (three). Furthermore, all of the women of color directors this year were Asian (Ganatra, Shi, Song, Kang, Hikari and Zhao); none were Black, Hispanic/Latina, Native American, Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander or Middle Eastern/North African. Overall, women of color still represent just 1.9% of all top-grossing movie directors across 19 years, despite the fact that their films earned the highest average and media scores compared to white male directors, white women and men of color.

	â€œIt is clear that when it comes to directors, hiring decisions are not made solely on the basis of performance,â€ said Dr. Smith. â€œIf that were the case, then women of color would receive significantly more opportunities to work behind the camera in film. These results demonstrate that the quality of movies by women of color is not only overlooked, it is actively ignored.â€

	By distributor, Universal Pictures (9.4%) and Walt Disney Studios (8%) lead the way in terms of hiring women directors over the studyâ€™s 19-year span; meanwhile, Paramount (2%), Lionsgate (4.3%) and 20th Century (4.6%) hired the lowest percentage of women. In 2025, Walt Disney Studios attached three women directors to top-grossing films while Universal Pictures and â€œotherâ€ distributors attached two. Paramount, Warner Bros. and Lionsgate did not have a woman director across their top films this year.

	The report contrasts these results by indicating significantly higher percentages of women directing films in the U.S. dramatic competition at Sundance Film Festival (63.6% for 2026), directing television episodes (37% in the 2023-2024 season) and helming Netflix movies (20.5% in 2024).
	

	Read the full study on the USC Annenberg Inclusion Initiativeâ€™s website.

	[Pictured: ChloÃ¨ Zhao directs on the set of â€œHamnetâ€ and Celine Song directs on the set of â€œMaterialists.â€]

schema.headline: Women Directors Make Up 8% of This Yearâ€™s 100 Top-Grossing Filmmakers in a Steep Drop From 2024, Study Shows

title: â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™ Leads U.K., Ireland Holiday Box Office as New Releases Crowd Top 10
description: Disneyâ€™s â€œAvatar: Fire And Ashâ€ held the No. 1 position at the U.K. and Ireland box office for a second weekend, adding Â£6.1 million ($8.2 million)
body:
Disneyâ€™s â€œAvatar: Fire And Ashâ€ held the No. 1 position at the U.K. and Ireland box office for a second weekend, adding Â£6.1 million ($8.2 million) and lifting its total to Â£20.8 million ($28 million), according to Comscore. The threequel comfortably dominated the Christmas corridor, outperforming a packed slate of holiday newcomers.

	Lionsgate U.K.â€™s erotic thriller â€œThe Housemaid,â€ starring Sydney Sweeney and Amanda Seyfried, debuted in second place with $6 million, marking one of the strongest adult-skewing openings of the Christmas corridor. Paramountâ€™s â€œThe Spongebob Movie: Search For Squarepantsâ€ followed in third, launching with $4.1 million.
	

	Disneyâ€™s â€œZootopia 2â€ moved to No. 4 in its fifth weekend, earning $2.1 million for a cumulative $30.4 million, while Entertainment Film Distributorsâ€™ newcomer â€œMarty Supremeâ€ opened at No. 5 on $1.9 million.


	Sonyâ€™s â€œAnacondaâ€ arrived in sixth place with $1.7 million, edging ahead of Universalâ€™s â€œWicked: For Good,â€ which placed seventh. The musical added $1.1 million to bring its total to $60.3 million, cementing its status as one of the yearâ€™s biggest performers.

	Further down the chart, Moviegoers Entertainmentâ€™s Bollywood blockbuster â€œDhurandharâ€ ranked eighth with $343,000, pushing its cumulative gross to $3.4 million. Mubiâ€™s â€œSentimental Valueâ€ opened at No. 9 on $339,000, narrowly ahead of Berkshire Dreamhouseâ€™s Malayalam-language comedy â€œSarvam Maya,â€ which rounded out the top 10 with $228,000.

	The first major wide release of 2026 arrives on Thursday, Jan. 1, with Universal rolling out musical drama â€œSong Sung Blueâ€ across more than 300 locations. Directed by Craig Brewer, the film stars Hugh Jackman and Kate Hudson.
	

	Also opening Thursday is Viavixâ€™s Hong Kong drama â€œNo Time for Goodbye,â€ directed by Don Ng and starring Lam Yiu-Sing and Kitty Yu. 

	Friday, Jan. 2, sees Picturehouse Entertainment releasing Ira Sachsâ€™ docudrama â€œPeter Hujarâ€™s Day,â€ while BFI Distribution opens Frederick Wisemanâ€™s culinary documentary â€œMenus-Plaisirs: Les Troisgros.â€ 

	Trinity Filmed Entertainmentâ€™s historical science fiction film â€œBack To The Past,â€ directed by Ng Yuen-fai and Jack Lai and starring Louis Koo, Jessica Hsuan and Raymond Lam, opens on 25-plus sites.

	Park Circus brings two high-profile anniversary releases to cinemas: animated hit â€œHappy Feetâ€ returns for its 20th anniversary across 100-plus locations, while David Lynchâ€™s â€œBlue Velvetâ€ marks its 40th anniversary with a similarly scaled reissue.

schema.headline: â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™ Leads U.K., Ireland Holiday Box Office as New Releases Crowd Top 10

title: Disney World Employee Gets Clobbered by Giant Boulder on Video
description:
Disney World Disaster
                          Staffer Bowled Over and Bloodied ...
body:
Disney World Disaster
                          Staffer Bowled Over and Bloodied ...
                          By Gigantic 'Indiana Jones' Boulder!!!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 31, 2025
                            6:24 AM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  December 31, 2025
                                7:00 AM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Walt Disney World was the site of yet another scare when a massive prop boulder slammed into a worker, knocking him off his feet ... with blood spurting from his head.
      
    
          Video of the shocking scene surfaced Tuesday on TikTok ... the clip opens with a crowd of people watching the Indiana Jones Epic Stunt Spectacular at Disney's Hollywood Studios in Florida -- and everything seems normal at first.
      
    
          Waiting for your permission to load TikTok Post.
      
    
          When the boulder from the epic "Raiders of the Lost Ark" opening scene starts rolling toward a man playing the role of the famous film character, Dr. Henry Walton "Indiana" Jones Jr., before it suddenly veers off course. The giant orb hurtles toward the audience ... and an employee steps in front of it to block its path.
      

                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          And that's when the worker gets clobbered -- and bloodied! What happens next ... well, you'll just have to watch it yourself.
      
    
          As we've reported ... Disney World has been rocked by a bunch of recent deaths on its property, with three occurring within a 10-day period.
      
    
          Hopefully, things turn around for Mickey Mouse in the new year!

                Disney World

title: Authorities Find Body and Gun During Search for Missing Texas Teen
description:
Camila Mendoza Olmos
                          Police Find Corpse And Gun Near Missing Teen's Hom
body:
Camila Mendoza Olmos
                          Police Find Corpse And Gun Near Missing Teen's Home
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 31, 2025
                            5:19 AM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  December 31, 2025
                                6:24 AM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Authorities in Texas discovered a body on Tuesday during their ongoing search for 19-year-old Camila Mendoza Olmos, who disappeared after leaving her home on Christmas Eve, police said.
      
    
          Bexar County Sheriff deputies and FBI agents were scouring a field near Olmos' house Tuesday afternoon when they stumbled upon the corpse, according to Sheriff Javier Salazar.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Salazar said the Medical Examiner will identify the remains over the next couple days and determine a cause of death.
      

          The sheriff also said investigators found a gun next to the body, which they're trying to match to a missing firearm that belongs to Olmos' relative.
      
    
          Furthermore, Salazar said authorities uncovered information indicating Olmos was depressed and suicidal. He noted she was having a rough time in school and at work, which was compounded by a relationship that went sour.
      
    
          On Tuesday ... the sheriff released dashcam video showing a figure walking along the shoulder of a roadway during the early morning hours on Christmas Eve. Around that time, Olmos was last seen on surveillance video at her home nearby.
      
      
              
            
              Related articles
            
        
              
          
                          
                Camila Mendoza Olmos

title: 'The Wire' Actor Isiah Whitlock Jr. Dead at 71
body:
Isiah Whitlock Jr.
                          Dead at 71
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              
                December 30, 2025
                
                            3:17 PM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  December 30, 2025
                                5:31 PM PST
                                    
      
    
          Beloved actor Isiah Whitlock Jr. -- perhaps best known for his catchphrase "Sheeeeeit..." from "The Wire" -- has died ... TMZ has confirmed.
      
    
          The Hollywood veteran passed away peacefully Tuesday in New York following a short illness, his manager Brian Liebman tells us. Deadline was first to report his death.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Whitlock starred as corrupt Senator R. Clayton Davis on "The Wire" and had recurring roles on "Veep," "Your Honor," and "Atlanta."
      
    
          Whitlock collaborated with Spike Lee on several film projects, including "25th Hour" -- where he originated his signature phrase -- "BlacKkKlansman," "Da 5 Bloods," and "Chi-Raq."
      

          Most recently, he lent his voice to the upcoming Pixar/Disney animated feature "Hoppers," due out in March.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Whitlock's manager Brian Liebman told Deadline, "Isiah was a brilliant actor and even better person. He was loved by all who had the pleasure to work with or know him. He will be greatly missed.â€
      
    
          He was 71.
      
    
          RIP

title: Iris' Coworker Hannah In 'The Holiday' 'Memba Her?!
body:
Iris' Coworker Hannah In
                          'The Holiday'
                          'Memba Her?!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 31, 2025
                            12:45 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
          English actress Sarah Parish was in her late 30s when she played Iris' snarky yet supportive coworker in the 2006 holiday rom-com film "The Holiday."
      
    
          Sarah joined a stellar cast including Cameron Diaz as the successful movie trailer business owner, Amanda, Jude Law as the sensitive and romantic book editor and widower, Graham, and Kate Winslet as the intelligent society columnist for The Daily Telegraph in London, Iris.
      
    
          Jack Black also co-starred in the classic!
      
    
          Guess what she looks like now in her late 50s!
